publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2650# Mr Andrew Arbuckle: Protected Geographical Indicator Status for Scotch Whisky—That the Parliament believes that EU Protected Geographical Indicator (PGI) status for Scotch whisky would provide a further selling point for the end product; welcomes the fact that this would require the use of Scottish-only grain in the manufacture of Scotch whisky; believes that the industry should apply for PGI status to help ensure the long-term sustainability of Scottish cereal growing, and considers that any such application should be supported by the Scottish Executive. Supported by: Roseanna Cunningham*, Christine May*, Robert Brown*, Dr Jean Turner*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mike Rumbles*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Eleanor Scott*, Mike Pringle*, Mr John Swinney*
S2M-2650 #Protected Geographical Indicator Status for Scotch Whisky (lodged on 24 March 2005) Chris Ballance*, Alex Neil*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Margaret Smith*, Rob Gibson*
S2M-2650 #Protected Geographical Indicator Status for Scotch Whisky (lodged on 24 March 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-2650 # Mr Andrew Arbuckle: Protected Geographical Indicator Status for Scotch Whisky—That the Parliament believes that EU Protected Geographical Indicator (PGI) status for Scotch whisky would provide a further selling point for the end product; welcomes the fact that this would require the use of Scottish-only grain in the manufacture of Scotch whisky; believes that the industry should apply for PGI status to help ensure the long-term sustainability of Scottish cereal growing, and considers that any such application should be supported by the Scottish Executive. Supported by: Roseanna Cunningham, Christine May, Robert Brown, Dr Jean Turner, Nora Radcliffe, Mike Rumbles, Mr Mark Ruskell, Eleanor Scott, Mike Pringle, Chris Ballance, Alex Neil, Mr Jamie Stone, Margaret Smith, Rob Gibson, Donald Gorrie
S2M-2650# Protected Geographical Indicator Status for Scotch Whisky (lodged on 24 March 2005) Alex Johnstone* R
S2M-2650# Protected Geographical Indicator Status for Scotch Whisky (lodged on 24 March 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*
